title: Flexible Packaging Market in APAC 2015-2019 New Report forecasts industry growth
text:
(MENAFN Press) Fast Market Research announces the availability of Technavio's new report "Flexible Packaging Market in APAC 2015-2019" on their comprehensive research portal.
In broad terms packaging refers to the technology of enclosing a product for the purpose of storage distribution sale and use. Flexible packaging is a non-rigid method of packaging and flexible packaging products are made from flexible materials such as plastic aluminum and paper. These materials undergo a detailed conversion process such as printing lamination coating and extrusion to develop different types of flexible packaging products such as plastic bags and pouches lidding films foil bags and sachets. Packaging these days is not only used to protect a product from spoilage but it has also become important in improving the overall aesthetic appeal of the product providing essential information about the product maintaining the freshness of food and beverages and providing convenience for consumers in terms of handling/carrying the product.
Technavio's analysts forecast the flexible packaging market in APAC to grow at a CAGR of 5.38% in terms of revenue over the period 2014-2019.

Commenting on the report an analyst from Technavio’s team said: “Vendors are currently opting for the acquisitive route to increase their presence in developed and developing markets for flexible packaging expand their product portfolio and achieve economies of scale in production. Through acquisitions vendors are able to focus more on product innovation and increase their profit margins by collaborating with each other. To maintain and expand their market share in the highly fragmented flexible packaging market in APAC companies are trying to acquire other small packaging companies and this is expected to positively influence market growth during the forecast period.”
According to the report nowadays people have busy schedules so they are looking for convenience in everyday products especially food beverages and toiletries which require minimum time and effort to open carry and store. Most flexible packaging designs incorporate features such as zippers pouring spouts and peel-off lids and many are microwavable which provides consumers with convenience in consuming and disposing of products. Such designs are increasingly being produced to meet the consumer demand for food and beverage products that offer higher convenience and portability. Therefore flexible packaging is increasingly being adopted by manufacturers of consumer products to suit the needs of their customers.
Further the report states that the intense price competition affects the profitability of vendors as they tend to reduce the prices of their products to survive in this competitive environment which is a challenge for the overall market.
The key players in the Flexible Packaging Market in APAC are Amcor Automated Packaging Systems Cosmo Films Innovia Films Mondi Printpack SIT Group and Wipak while other prominent vendors include Bellmark CL&D Graphics Clear Lam Packaging Fres-co System USA Glenroy JL Packaging Oracle Packaging Paharpur 3P PERUPLAST Phoenix Closures Prolamina and Rollprint Packaging Products
The study was conducted using an objective combination of primary and secondary information including inputs from key participants in the industry. The report contains a comprehensive market and vendor landscape in addition to a SWOT analysis of the key vendors.
